segments.text: So what's up?  What's new?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well Vegas was awesome.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  I heard.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And, um, I got married.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up.  No- in Vegas?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.  In the old town part.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Who did you marry?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Chuck. [LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Did you propose to you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Um- Yes.  It was very romantic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It was at the slot machines.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh.  The Wheel of Fortune slots?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Uhuh, uhuh.  He won big and he-and he realized that the only thing that would make it better was me as his bride.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He turned to you and was like...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Hey.  Let's get married and I said okay.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] That's really romantic.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.  Well.  You know, because he's leaving the next day.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: But we're going to have a honeymoon cruise.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Does that mean that you're going to get citizenship, too, in- in England or whatever?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  I hadn't even thought about that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  Think about that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He's not going to be a citizen, though.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  But he'll have like a long visa.  Can you go visit then for a long time?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  Totally.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, how are you going to do the long distance thing?  So wait, are you going to move there?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I guess I'll-  I guess I'll have an internet husband.[LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Like you need another one of those.[LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I have an internet boyfriend.  I guess I'll have to juggle the two.  Is that cheating?  I don't know. Hmm.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Is that your phone?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah, so [LAUGHTER] He's calling me now
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He loves you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He likes to keep tabs, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How much did he win at the slot?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Uh, I think seven hundred and fifty dollars.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really? Penny slots?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Penny slots. That's what he plays.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Wow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm a big fan of the Wheel of Fortune quarters. But it just costs so much.  I don't know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  We played Wheel of Fortune pennies.  It's like a giant thing with like-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: But the pennies always get you because you end up spending like, you know, fifty bucks.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Fifty bucks. Mmhmm.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: like, wait, but it's just pennies.  You're like, wait a minute I'm on to you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well so now we're married. We have cat children.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Awesome.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] Cat babies.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We renamed Brenda, Lumber Janet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's fair enough.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She needs a new name each state that we go into. [LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: F
